channel.title: Loading Sprites from an alternate location [Galkons]

item.title: Loading Sprites from an alternate location [Galkons]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:2, topic:522238”]when constructing a “Sprite” there is a location predefined within the class (usually named location) I presume yours would look like this:

String location = signlink.findcachedir() + "Sprites";

in that case, adding “/Sprites/” to your path is redundant and causes your issue[/quote]
Oh tits, so I should just have:
modIcons[idx] = new Sprite(signlink.findcachedir() + “/Crowns/MODICONS_”+idx+"");

I played around with the link using something like these, and no avail still.
/Crowns/MODICONS_
Crowns/MODICONS_
./Crowns/MODICONS_

Edit:
Fixed.

Read full topic
item.source: Loading Sprites from an alternate location [Galkons]

item.title: Loading Sprites from an alternate location [Galkons]
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

when constructing a “Sprite” there is a location predefined within the class (usually named location) I presume yours would look like this:

String location = signlink.findcachedir() + "Sprites";

in that case, adding “/Sprites/” to your path is redundant and causes your issue

Read full topic
item.source: Loading Sprites from an alternate location [Galkons]

item.title: Loading Sprites from an alternate location [Galkons]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay so everything in my cache is well, cache packed except for the background.
Now, I can’t edit the cache (Tom’s doesn’t want to open it ).
So instead, I want to load my Mod Icons through the folders.
I’ve tried this:

			try {
				for(int idx = 0; idx < 20; idx++){
					modIcons[idx] = new Sprite(signlink.findcachedir() + "/Sprites/Crowns/MODICONS_"+idx+"");
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
			}

Note: The only part I changed was after new Sprite(.

It didn’t load the sprites at all, can someone help?

Read full topic
